definition: to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: And these various feedback mechanisms quickly facilitate jumpstarting the necessary people into action.
sentences.chinese: 這些反饋機制能夠及時協助有關人員迅速採取行動。

sentences.english: In order for these techniques to be effective, you have to act on them.
sentences.chinese: 要想讓這些方法變得有效，你必須據此採取行動。

sentences.english: We'd better get everything straight before taking any action.
sentences.chinese: 我們最好把所有相關事宜都捋順再採取行動。

sentences.english: The Secretary-General has taken action in all areas of reform under his authority.
sentences.chinese: 祕書長已在受其管轄的全部改革領域採取行動。

sentences.english: No longer like puppet, not as acted upon a puppet.
sentences.chinese: 不再像木偶，不採取行動作爲一個傀儡。

sentences.english: As the market slumps, homeowners are taking action to stop the build-up of boards.
sentences.chinese: 隨着市場的低迷，房主正在採取行動，制止集結板。

sentences.english: So be slow to take action or to make statements you might later regret...
sentences.chinese: 因此，別急着採取行動，或發表聲明，免得日後後悔。

sentences.english: There will be no retrospective global agreement to undo the damage we have caused.
sentences.chinese: 全球一致採取行動治理我們已經造成的損害刻不容緩。

sentences.english: Requires operator to re-enter user name and password before an action is taken.
sentences.chinese: 運營商需要重新輸入用戶名和密碼之前採取行動。

sentences.english: Red tape encumbered all our attempts at action.
sentences.chinese: 繁文縟節阻礙了我們爲採取行動而作的所有努力。

sentences.english: We are moving to replace mutually assured destruction with mutual cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在採取行動，以共同合作代替同歸於盡。

sentences.english: Actions must be taken promptly and order be restored as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 必須迅速採取行動，儘快恢復秩序。

sentences.english: A:I think it's time for the govemment to take action.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲政府該採取行動了。

sentences.english: Management and union rank and filer alike hoped congress would act quickly.
sentences.chinese: 資方與工會會員都希望國會迅速採取行動。

sentences.english: More often than not, your fear will go away once you take action.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你採取行動，恐懼自然就灰飛煙滅了。

sentences.english: So plan a little and then take action.
sentences.chinese: 所以還是把計劃定小一些，然後採取行動吧。

definition: to implement/to carry out/to execute/to run
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to handle/to take care of/to punish

to lock (a door)/to close with a latch/to lock into place/a lock/a latch/to lock a computer file (to prevent it being overwritten)/to lock (denying access to a computer system or device or files, e.g. by password-protection)/to focus attention on/to target
